Description: Body fragment of large North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; glaze fired largely red-brown; interior glazed with one red band lined in white; exterior: upper frieze, hindquarters of a seated sphinx to left in black-figure; lower frieze: goats grazing to left; filling ornaments: dotted rosettes, cross and pendant roundel; purple patch on flank of wild goat and on back of seated sphinx; between the friezes broad band with added red band lined in white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
By the same hand as Ashmolean G119.13. For parallels, see Cambridge NA25 and NA26.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 38)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.179)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
